caption: Best udon in Boston

They have the BEST udon in Cambridge and Boston, hands down. The cold udon is by far our favorite and we are dangerously hooked. They do order-to-pickup during covid and we really can't wait to go there when things get back to normal. Sara and the rest of the crew are incredibly kind and fun. We love their "because I have dreams" messaging, it's just so good hearted. Couldn't recommend this place enough.

Reaaaaaaal good. You gotta try it. Broth is really good and tasty (I've only tried the hot+spicy version so far) but I think the noodles and meat are actually the stars here. It tasted so good I immediately bought two more orders to let my parents try it. Better than its ramen counterpart (Katare) imo
Amazing cold udon! Definitely try out spicy cold udon.
Delicious udon and broth. Definitely a must try
The cold udon is insanely delicious!! The price is a little bit too much though

Hand crafted authentic udon noodles from Yume Ga Arukara. You use to have to wait hours for udon noodles, yesterday we ordered 5 bowls 🍜(family dinner) for pickup from the toast takeout app and it was seamless and there is no wait!  We ate it all! Please add hot udon noodle bowls to your takeout menu for the winter!  Update 11/13/20: They now offer hot Udon noodle bowls!!!  Just had it tonight and it was so delicious for a rainy dreary day.  We picked it up at 4:15 pm and ate dinner at 6 pm and reboiled the soup and it was perfect.  We will be back soon for hot Udon for the winter weather.  Pro tip: get the extra noodles; it is worth it!

Hands down the best udon place in and around Boston! Although most people love their cold udon more , I prefer the hot niku udon. They just started adding it to their takeout menu in oct 2020 and I was not expecting same quality as eating in. But they surprised me . It was exactly the same delicious hot udon as you would eat in dine in . Highly recommend getting their udon even as takeout!
Their spicy cold udon is so addicting. I order from here at least once a month
Get the spicy cold udon with extra beef and tare. So freaken good, incredibly consistent, super delicious. 11/10

Drove from New Hampshire to get this udon and omg !! They did not disappoint!!  Being stationed all over the place I love to find really good udon spots nearby and this place is it. Great quality food and awesome staff that takes pride in what they do. Definitely will be driving back again!
Absolutely wonderful - amazing and knowledgeable staff, take it to the nearby Cambridge Common and enjoy a socially distanced picnic
THE BEST udon place. Don't miss out!

Unfortunately, I didn’t really like the noodles that much. I got the spicy one with extra noodles and extra meat. I have tried noodles at many places including Tokyo. Maybe I had too high expectations after hearing people praising this place.
Best noodles I have ever had. The softness of Udon noodles is absolutely unique.

It’s pretty disappointing to see the lack of options due to the COVID outbreak, nonetheless, I tried the Spicy Cold Udon. The noodles were pretty bland to say the least. The meat was really the only thing I actually enjoyed. I’m glad some people tend to enjoy the cold Udon but in my opinion, I’d rather stick with something hot. But regardless, the staff is extremely polite! They wear gloves and masks when handling your food. I have nothing against the staff, only the food.
The only restaurant in Boston area that beats out their peers who specialize in the same dishes found in the superior gastronomic cities of LA NY and SF.
Perfect
Had a very good experience in here with my kid. The food arrived rapidly and the customer service is just fantastic. Prices are fair.

The best udon in greater Boston! Freshly made udon on site. Options of cold, cold spicy, and hot with selections to add (or remove) beef and amount of udon. I am not a big fan of beef so usually I skip beef and go triple or quadruple of udon. Love it!!

Small and cozy place. It’ve got a long line but fast moving. I was there during the dinner time on the weekday, but it’s only 20 mins waiting. We ordered the both non-spicy and spicy cold noodles. One with no meat cuz i dont eat meat (i got discount on no meat dish, 👍🏼) The noodle was chewy and the sauce was so good. The portion was huge for me so I couldnt finish them, so prepare your stomach!  That -1 star is that I got the seat at the bar on the far left, and there’re containers for the ingredients in front of me (behind the counter). I’m afraid if some of the sauce splashed into those containers, which highly to occur eating noodles. I recommend the shop install any partition to protect them from any contamination.
Surreal place with amazing udon.
Lovely staff and heartwarming food!
Long line as always . The best Udon
very tasty. But very long line
Love love LOVE this place. The cold udon was so good and perfectly balanced in flavor. The noodles were amazingly bouncy and had the right amount of chew. Very well done dish. 10/10 would reccomend!!
It’s amazing. I commute from Porter and I struggle not going there everyday.
Love it, especially their noodle. My recommendation that youshould order extra noodle
A must go to when in Boston. The spicy cold udon is amazing. Add double meat and you'll be left with a very satisfied stomach.

Yume is always worth the wait! They have 3 selections to choose from: spicy cold, cold, and hot. I love all three but the hot is the best for a cold day. The broth is very light yet flavorful, and their udon noodles are soft and well-made.
The udon is the only thing on the menu because it's perfect. Slurp it up fast, and go about your day. There's generally a little line, but it moves fast. Just go here.
Absolutely the best udon in town Be prepared for a significant wait during the dinner service as this is a hot spot! I recommend the cold spicy udon, as they have perfectly cooked beef and noodles
Very tasty. I liked the hot soup version and my family liked the cold version.
Good hot udon, with options for extra (noodles, beef).  Haven't tried the cold.  Wish they had a spicy hot option, but I didn't ask so that might be on me.

Love the udons and the enthusiasm of the employees. Everyone is so passionate and energetic. The cold and hot udon is a perfect meal all year long. You can always add extra meat, spice, and noodles. One you finish your entire bowl, including the broth, you'll get a perfect!
Very good, though waiting line is long
So good. The wait is worth it best Udon I have ever had. Large quantity and friendly staff. Great community to go with the amazing food.

I basically don't eat breakfast and lunch in the days I go to yume. Today it was hot, extra spicy and extra extra noodles and guess what..finished it in 14 minutes flat. Super Perfect!  Unparalleled udon experience in Boston if I might say so. And a couple of japanese friends have told me that this is pretty much the real deal.  Give it a go!
(Translated by Google) It was a bit short but delicious!  (Original) 약간 짧짤했지만 맛있었어요!
Worth the wait! We each ordered extra noodles and meat. That was the right choice.
Good food. Not happy with the food handling habits of the staff. Bowls were washed in the sink with ?cold? water? The same gloves were used to wash bowls and prepare food.
Best udon noodles I've had in Boston. Period. Worth the usual 1 hour wait. Can't go wrong with either the hot or cold noodles.
Amazing bowl of hot udon! You Must go for extra beef, or double extra beef.

This is the most amazing udon... No the most amazing noodle I've ever had. The noodles are perfectly chewy, the broth is perfectly salty and flavored, the meat is succulent and delicious, the portions easily expandable. It's perfect.
Completely awesome! Delicious food.  Straightforward and customized system. Cash only, and come early.
Strongly recommend their cold udon especially spicy cold.

Tried their cold udon noodle, I'm in love with this dish now. The texture of the udon and flavor of the broth mixed with the side ingredients, goes so well. I usually never finish the broth but this got me downing it. Definitely recommend trying it out. I will be back for more of these!
Absolutely love Yume Ga Arukara! The wait is worth it every time, and I’ve been dragging new friends here.

Sometime when you have too much choices it take forever to make a decision. But this place simplify it to three items menu (or 4 -I don't recall) all noodle. The line is long but it is worth the wait. The noodle are delicious & hearty with good portion that leave u fulfill. I love coming here but my friends.
Best. Udon. Noodles. Ever.  The classic cold noodles never fail to satisfy, and you dont even feel heavy after eating a generous serving size of it!
A great place to explore your dreams and do a good job eating udon.

Impressive collection of Japanese taste foods. Popular dishes include Spicy Cold Niku Udon, Cold Niku Udon, Hot Niku Udon, etc. This restaurant is very ordinarily decorated. Good place for a small budget meal. Got to see so many Japanese and Asian poeple here.
Amazing udon!
Slurpy udon! Reminds me of home
haven't eaten there. But if you don't have anything thing better to do. Go there for dinner it'll be an all evening event. The line is ridiculous. Must be very popular.
Try the cold udon. could the best.

They have a limited menu, but I like beef and noodles, and their niku udon is delightful. You can get it on a plate or in a bowl with broth, and I always go for the bowl  The service is very quick, aside from the line to get seated. Once you're seated, expect to receive your food within 5 minutes or so.

They make their udon with love. It may sound cheesy, but the noodles are handcrafted, and they put care into every bowl they assemble. The spicy cold will always be my go to; you get the bold authentic taste of a Japanese mentsuyu (a soy sauce based cold broth for noodles), with an added flair of spice. Ingredients are fresh - this place is worth the wait.
This is delicious
Awesome I've never expected we can have such a delicious Udon noodle here in the US
We waited one hour but it was worth it

I've never liked udon noodles until I came here! I've got to give it up to this place for amazing udon BUT you will have to wait a long time. We came at 4:50pm on Saturday and there was already a significant line forming. While we waited, the server took our order, and we proceeded to wait until 5:40pm when we paid and got seated at one of the two long tables (we got seated in the back row so views were not that exciting). We got one cold niku udon and one hot niku udon, both non-spicy, and our food came immediately.  The noodles lived up to the hype. The cold udon were some of the chewiest noodles I've ever had, and so refreshing and not-heavy. The hot udon broth was rich but we didn't feel that it was as refreshing or flavorful as the cold. The noodles also weren't as chewy.  Things to note: Cash only! Bring your dolla bills. Also, I would definitely recommend getting extra noodles and meat. I'm not the biggest eater and even I didn't leave feeling very full. Lastly, Yume is a small noodle stand in the back of the Lesley University building. I was a bit confused upon arrival so hope this info helps!

We had hot udon noodles bowls,  you can add more  toppings & noodles for extra charges.  It was my 1st time here so I tried regular portion but my friends added extra noodles to theirs. Food was good and portion is a bit small but I wasn't that hungry and I didn't found much beef. The broth was very delicious and service was very nice. Our server kept checking on us. Next time I will add extra noodles as my friends did.
The place translates to I have a dream and the bowl of udon itself is a dream come true. Triple everything and thank me later.
(Translated by Google) Delicious. The noodles are chewy. There are always many queues so I recommend going early.  (Original) 맛있습니다. 면이 쫄깃해요. 대기줄이 늘 많으니 일찍 가는걸 추천해요.

We were visiting Boston from Germany and got this place recommended by a local. It was superb!!  The price/amount of food ratio is fine and the taste is absolutely delicious! Some of the best food I've ever had for this price. I'm actually quite sad, that we have left Boston and I won't get to eat there again for quite some time... Strong recommend!!
Such a cool place. Great food, great service and great vibe.
Overpriced, and really just par regarding flavor. Cash only, minimum price is $16

If you been to Yume wo Katare for ramen, this place has the same set up with two rows of seatings facing the kitchen. There are three udon choices: cold udon ($13), spicy cold udon ($16) and hot udon soup. I got the regular spicy cold udon, didnt think it was spicy at all. The amount of food they gave me was enough and filling. The sauce they put in it is refreshing and light. The noodles were long and chewy. There were probaby 5 pieces of beef in the regular. When you order, they will ask if you want to adjust the amount of food. For me the regular was enough. You can ask for more beef or more noodles. This place only takes cash. They do not take rsvp and the wait for seating are usually about 45 minutes to an hour. I suggest getting there 5-10 minutes before they open or 1.5 hrs before they close. Any time in between you may have to wait at least an hour.

If you're on a ramen/noodle quest, this is must try.  Cold udon was surprisingly delicious, unique, and light. I would come here again and try the other options. The beef wasn't remarkable. It felt like the protein was there for protein. I had the extra beef and it didn't look like there was much extra from regular serving. Beef was too cooked but it was nice and fatty. Recommend extra noodles for the cold udon bowl. Broth was absolutely delicious.  Docked a star because it's cash only and wait lines are ridiculous (no reservations).

Very tasty udon. Similar atmosphere to their sister ramen restaurant, yume wo katare. The menu has 3 dish options: cold udon, cold and spicy (which is $3 more), and hot udon (also $3 more than the cold). Then you can add extra noodles or extra beef for additional charges.  I disagree with having the addition of chili oil cost $3, similar to the ramen place. There is usually a line when they open, so it can be difficult to get a seat. Cash only.
Heavenly noodles, broth is so good, preparation is excellent
Really friendly staff and a fantastic bowl of hot udon that was absolutely worth the wait.
Delicious food. Simple menu. I tried the hot (temperature) udon. There is also cold and spicy. Friendly service. Cash only.
Absolutely delishious!
The service was so welcoming and the balance of the Niku Udon was great! A must try!

Best udon in MA—you already know. Spicy cold is actually better than the hot; the al dente texture of the noodles is preserved at this temperature, and is too soft in the hot bowl. Way worth the wait!
Best noodles ever.
Had cold spicy and hot udon. Both are great. Cold one is not overly spicy, had a great aroma. And hot one soup is so yummy u can def finish the entire bowel easily.

This restaurant is my number one restaurant.  Of all restaurants I know I favor it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to this restaurant. when  I feel like having a delicious supper, this restaurant comes instantly to my mind. superb and varied  food and a large list of dishes.trained team, and nice spirit. In addition to that, the charge is honest. I suggest this spot with no hesitation.

Usually, I don't like to wait more than 30 min for food (just looking for another place to eat),  hour waiting was so long to be there. However their taste of Udon was excellent and it can be a simple excuse for that long waiting time. I visited their almost 1~2 month ago, now I am regretting that I only ordered for a one extra Udon instead of two.

These people pours their heart and soul for this bowl of amazing udon. Hands down to the best udon restaurant in Boston. Go for the signature cold niku udon, you won't regret it. There's a reason why the line is getting longer and longer, because it's that great of a udon place. Authentic and affordable!
Delicious hand crafted udon noodles in delicious (hot or cold) broth! Get there early because there's always a line and they sometimes run out of noodles. Worth the wait. Cash only.
A little pricey, but you get what you pay for: Delicious udon with the perfect amount of bite in a savory and perfectly seasoned broth. Kind staff, friendly environment, and clean
(Translated by Google) Best Cold Udon Ever .. 👍 I will go to Boston every time.  (Original) Best Cold 우동 Ever.. 👍 보스턴 올 때마다 갈거에요
Best udon spot in Boston

牛~ドーン！！！😍 Unfortunately there's no vegetarian options here, think the broth is seafood? (from what ankther customer asked) The regular hot gyudon bowl is a bit spicy (perfect!!!) and the noodles are fantabulous. Cash only, definitely worth the ATM run.
Have tried the hot and cold noodles, not sure if it was because I had just had the cold noodles but hot noodles broth is not as good.
Great taste. Amazing.
Worth the wait as their udon is delicious!
Best udon I had ever had as of yet
Best udon I have ever had. Get there before it opens or else there will be a long wait.

Yummy for money worth but expect a long wait as this place can get popular. 2 noodle options hot or cold noodle. Tried hot and it was delicious. Next time I'll try cold noodle. Soo good. Oh no drink just water.
Ordered cold udon without beef. The udon is very fresh and chewy. It's a very refreshing meal on a hot day. But the service is OK and the wait is long even though we arrived at 5 pm.

Stayed at a place which is only 4 min walk away. Visited here several times. Never disappointed. So good!!!!! I tried each noodle choice, hot, cold, spicy. My son is big fan of ramen.  Highly recommended.

You get only three choices, but they are VERY good. The only reason I am not giving 5/5 is due to the location which can make it hard to get to and find parking. Not only that but depending on what time of day you get there, it could be a long wait before you can get a seat.

I ordered the spicy cold noodle udon for $15, and it was worth every bite--delicious! You get there, wait in the fast-moving queue, order and pay while you're in line, and indulge in the workers yelling "good job" and "perfect" as each customer finishes a bowl. Fun place for delicious and easy dinner.

I have been to this place twice now. The first time I got the hot bowl, which is really good and has some very interesting ingredients, like many tiny shrimp. The second time I got the cold bowl, which is absolutely amazing. If you go, I highly recommend getting that. The noodles and broth are tangy and balance incredibly well with the more rich and fatty meat. I do recommend getting extra noodles and/or meat because the normal portion is pretty small.
Get the Cold Spicy. Treat yourself with extra noodles and beef. Noodles are perfectly textured with somewhat springy consistency. Meat and broth and noodles are balanced so well.
Great Udon place. Friendly staff and quick service.
Spicy cold udon - perfect on a hot day. The chili oil is perfect, not that spicy but full of flavor.
very nice, authentic, tasty udon
Delicious Udon!
Ordered the Spicy cold niku udon! So good! The wait was about 45 mins though, as seating is very limited. Well worth the wait nevertheless!
The cold udon is the way to go! slurp and go, no BS sort of place, we need more places like this!
Amazing.

Arrived around 12pm on a Wednesday and waited for 30min. Awesome food and service. CASH ONLY but you can find a BOA ATM nearby. That spicy one is not that spicy so I believe many people can have a try if you want.

So the wait time is long depending on when you arrive and the portions are borderline food challenge size. After you are done eating you can share your dreams to the crowd. Also it is cash only and you might wanna skip breakfast and lunch if you decide to go
"Perfect"

Alright, some things to know: cash only and you'll need $15-$16 per person (tax included so that's it). Drinks are free but no choice but tea and water. Wait times are about 20 minutes at 5 pm on Saturday. But the food is great, and the cash only makes things efficient. They have a very short menu, but you probably won't mind. Spicy version is not very spicy, so it's safe to try if you have some tolerance. They also don't like phones, which is why there aren't many pictures. Overall, I recommend them if you want good handmade Udon. (Side note, you need to pay for parking inside if you park in the lot outside - $3 pet hour, also cash only).  I'll say in closing, this isn't as good as you can get in Japan. But for what's available in the US, this is top notch.

It is a small store with only 18 seats.  The menu selection is limited but their ways of making the udon is speculator and perfectly cooked with rich broth.  Staff are friendly and always asked your feedback at the end.  If it is positive, it ended with a shout "Good Job!"  There is always a long lineup but worth all the waiting.

Best udon in Boston. This place is very popular, so expect a potentially 45+ minute wait for dinner. I had the niku udon and everything about it was spectacular. The noodles have the perfect texture and thickness. The broth is flavorful with just the right amount of heat. The beef is thinly sliced and tender. This place is unsurprisingly at the same level as yume so katare.
Very very delicious and very worth the wait

overpriced and overrated. The meat was fatty thin sliced beef (the one usually found in hot pot), very easy to cook and not very nutritious. Noodle was good. Soup was so so - nothing too sophisticated.
The best udon in the Boston area without a doubt. Friendly service and delicious food. Just be prepared to wait and bring cash.
Best udon in Boston, love this place

One of the best udon I had in a very long time. I didn't like the soup in the beginning (was too greasy) but after 3rd or 4th scoop, I knew I was going to finish the whole bowl. Worth the wait in line and most likely to revisit on my next trip to Boston.
It's good. Like really good.
Best Udon I've had!
Taste Good

I love udon and this place is great! I came on a weekend for lunch so I had to wait about 15-20 minutes before getting a seat, but that's not too bad. I got the spicy cold udon, and it was delicious! I (luckily) got seated at the counter and I was right in front of where the noodles are freshly made, which was fun and interesting to watch. My noodles took some time to be served but I understood why. Once they were served, I dug in and it was really tasty! The coldness was strange at first but noodles are chewy and slippery, and the broth is flavorful while not being too salty. The beef is good too even though there's a lot of fat. The spice adds a good amount of kick and adds to the flavor; it's great! I would definitely recommend this place; for $15 post-tax, it's a great price, quantity, and quality!
I always get the spicy cold noodles.

Went for dinner the other night and got the classic cold udon. Had to go back again the next night to try the spicy cold udon. Amazing — they know what they are doing. The team is extremely friendly and cares about the details. I will be back.
This place is amazing and all I want in life is their hot ramen. I haven't tried their spicy cold ramen yet, but now I have an excuse to go back soon! Highly recommend. 🍜💯

I love the way that this place almost optimized the entire food process! I came here on a weekday noon with a friend and got in a line of about 9 people and we were seated in about 15 minutes.  Food: To preface, I got a perfect score on the bowl, so I know what I’m talking about. I loved the mixture of ingredients in the udon bowl, from the meat to the veggies and it was made almost right in front of us! Super chewy noodles and savory soup.  Service: I loved how quickly things were made and we were seated and professional served!  Ambiance: Super casual, hole in the wall in a shopping center!  Would come again, more pricy than a fast food stop but worth it!
Worth the wait. Dont use your cell phone here, they dont like it!
I have eaten +500 Udon in Japan and believe this restaurant belongs to top 1%. Much better than even Udon restaurants in Japan 😁
Great noodle.
The niku is to die for, expect a line whenever you go

Always a good meal. I'm more of a hot udon guy. You can load up on noodles and beef. As with the ramen Yume, they also "grade" you.  Flavor for the hot is so good. A little sweet and great flavor. Doesn't feel fatty. Meat is soft and delicious.
Awesome food

As a fan of Yume Wo Katare I have been wanting to try it out for a while. This place was definitely good. I got the hot udon, with double beef. The broth and noodles were good, the beef was my favorite part. I wasn't expecting the shrimp, which was an oversight on my part, but I wasn't a fan.
Amazing every time
Best udon in the town!

The best noodles in Boston. Both the cold and hot udon are excellent but the cold udon is their specialty. Whether it's the rich seafood broth of the hot udon or the sweet light vinegar flavor of the cold udon their both excellent. Don't be surprised to wait 15-30 minutes, and be early because ingredients, broth, and noodles run out. Everything is made handmade each day and when it's done its done.
Staff are super nice, udon is delicious and we enjoyed our food in a friendly and cozy space:) highly recommended:)

Except the fact that I waited for one hour, the food was perfect! And the staffs are also perfect! Although hot and signature wudon both were good, I recommend signature wudon more!! Prepare some cash and go before the restaurant open.
The food here is amazing.
Best udon in the city - the spicy niku (beef) udon has a perfect dashi broth, great textural variation, and a chili paste with intense but balanced umami. Must not miss. The line moves decently fast
The best udon I have ever had.
Please try the spicy cold noodle. It's super tasty and very bearable even for the spice timid.
Get the spicy udon, it is out of this world good. Then come back and get both regular and regular hot udon. It's worth it. I don't think you'll find better udon in the Boston area.
(Translated by Google) Packkkked  (Original) Packkkked
Udon is so good here!
One of the few places in Cambridge that’s worth the wait. Delicious. Go with extra beef extra noodles.
I got the cold spicy udon but I tried the hot one too. Would recommend the hot one more! The cold udon doesn't have that rich broth.
Greatest cold udon place in the whole of Boston. The wait is worth the bowl of delicious niku udon
Great udon! Feel like the noodle can improve a bit more but was good overall
Worth the wait!

I've been seeing this place for a while and I've finally got the chance to try it. The line can be pretty long but it was worth the wait. The udon is great, the broth are fantastic, and the beef is nice and tender. Definitely will go back and try the cold udon next time!
Best udon I had in MA so far. Love the way they hand made the noodles. Very delicious. My favorite is the special on Tuesday to Thursday. - Cold spicy udon.
Best udon and probably top 5 noodle place in Boston

Amazing. I was recommended by a few friends to come try their food, and wow are udon noodles done the RIGHT way so much better.  There's a great amount of chew, a lot of textural complexity with the noodles contrasted by the tender beef and crunchy tempura/dried shrimps, and scallions.  The staff are very friendly and interested in having a great conversation with you, and they encourage you finishing the plate by yelling "PERFECT"!!!  I'm definitely coming back in the future.

There are two things that you should savor at this small udon joint, the food and the atmosphere.  Quite frankly that's all that matters in a small restaurant and Yume Ga Arukara delivers in a very profound manner.  Prepare your ears and eyes for the unique staff.  They have an abundance of energy that might have been conjured from the udon itself.  They cheer, they hustle around, they do everything to make the eating experience especially smooth.  Finish your food with an empty bowl/plate and be congratulated with a loud huzzah from the staff.  But also prepare your tastebuds for exceptional food. The bowl of hot udon with with extra meat that I ordered was perfection.  Slightly chewy noodles bathed in a very delectable broth.  The meat had a semi sweet taste to it as well, almost like Chinese char siu.  I slurped, drank, and repeated till my bowl was empty.  I couldn't stop eating, and there is certainly no stopping for this place in becoming a force to be reckoned with in the Cambridge food scene.

This is probably the best udon that's available in New England. They make their own noodles, and their broth is super tasty. As this is udon, it's much lighter than their ramen restaurant Yume Wo Katare. The meat in the hot udon was savory and sweet, much like the broth. The noodles were softer than what I prefer, but this is purely preference. I simply prefer udon noodles with more heft. I think I would say this is the best udon I've had outside of Japan!
The broth is amazing. I would definitely get the both broth with extra beef though.

My new favorite noodle place! Maybe blasphemous but I like this place way more than Yume wo Katare because this place is lighter on the palate and still savory enough to enjoy. They don't have a lot on their menu but they certainly do it well!
Best udon noodles!

An authentic Japanese udon shop. That's all they make. From the regular menu, choose either a hot udon in broth, or a cold udon with dipping sauce. Then choose no meat, single, double or triple meat. They currently have a spicy cold udon Sichuan on certain days.
Best noodles of my life!  Super nice staff and a great experience.  Cannot recommend enough!
This place is so tasty, super filling and absolutely great. Still my favorite eating experience in Boston. Long line is worth it.

Absolutely stellar.  I've been to Japan. I've worked as a cook at a Japanese restaurant.  I'm not fibbing when I say Yume Ga Arukara is the best bowl of noodles (Not just udon!) in the States.  I'd even go so far as to say its the top 3 bowls of noodles I've had in my life. Easily the best udon I've had.  Start with the cold noodles if it's your first time! I wish these guys nothing but the best.
Favorite restaurant in Massachusetts.
Delicious udon. Both the cold and hot tasted fantastic and I would definitely come again!

I can't stop thinking about these noodles. All I have to say is that it's delicious, incredibly flavorful, and I can't think of a single thing about it that I can criticize. The beef is pretty fatty but in this case I think it really added to the dish. Everything in the bowl compliments each other.  Everything is made fresh and I mean everything. I watched mounds of dough get turned into noodles right in front of my eyes. There are only two options on the menu. You can order hot noodles or cold noodles. Beyond that, you can add extra noodles and/or beef or have or have no beef at all. I ordered the hot bowl with 2x beef.  I loved it so much that after I had gotten to the point where there was only broth left in my bowl, I had to drink the rest because it was so delicious. A member of the staff took my bowl and saw that there was nothing left in it and exclaimed "We have a perfect!" to the customers and staff. The staff all cheered. It was a great experience I'll definitely be back.  A few things to note: There is limited seating, it's cash only, the waiting line is in a rather cramped hallway. Phone use is discouraged in order to encourage customers to finish their food and leave so that the next customer(s) can be seated, but I did not feel rushed or pressured to finish.  Writing this review made me hungry and I'm craving another bowl right now.

Unlike some places claim their noodles are hand made, they make it right there in front of your face and then cook it up in front of you. You can't get it any fresher. The noodles are precisly cooked, and the beef is so well marinated. I love that they put up signs to discourage cellphone usage to move people along. I would give it five stars if we didn't get yelled at to stay in line and be close to the wall. Don't get me wrong, I understand why we should be close to the wall while waiting but to get yelled at, that's not cool.
best udon i’ve had in boston. both hot and cold versions were great, and the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly.

Fantastic udon served either cold or hot (your choice). If you're lucky, they will also be serving their spicy udon (available cold only). The noodles are made in house, and the broth is perfectly balanced - deep flavor but not too salty. Takes me back to childhood in Japan. Be prepared to wait in line though as there's often a 45-60 min wait... But it's worth it!!!
First time here, my son had cold Udon, I had hot. I prefer cold.

Noodles are soft and silky smooth. Broth was a bit oily and salty. Lines go by ok, but still waited 45 minutes. They use fatty beef for their meats. They only have three options for you to choose from. I had the hot bowl
Amazing udon and awesome staff preparing it. Definitely try to go midweek for the spicy udon and get the extra beef.
Love the chefs there. Great atmosphere. You can tell they love what they do. Get ready to wait in line for 30+ minutes. Weekend 1pm.

Chef Tsuyoshi Nishioka turns out epic udon!  The depth of broth's flavor, the perfect noodles, and the beef make a legendary bowl!!  I shamelessly crushed the triple.  When asked what I was getting ready for, I said "a nap!"  😁

Fun place within food court. Seating is limited and you'll likely need to wait but the line moves quickly. Cash only but there are ATMs nearby. Upon finishing you get a rating based on how much you have left in your bowl. Decent spot but not sure I'd travel to eat here again.
One of the beat udon place in the world

Authentic udon made fresh every day. I've been going to Yume Wo Katare regularly for 2 years and was really excited when Yume Ga Arukara opened. The difference between Ga Aru Kara vs Wo Ka tare are the following:  1/ You don't share your dreams where as wo ka tare you do and encouraged. 2/ Udon is a lot easier to eat than Jiro ramen 3/ You don't have to wait outside 4/ They offer amazing bold green tea for free 5/ Pricer than wo ka tare, but worth every penny because you are getting fresh noodles and high quality ingredients. 6/ Portions is not as much as wo katare, but you have to know how much to ask for which can involve a bit of trial and error. I usually get cold udon, double beef, and extra extra noodles where I generally ask for 700-900 grams.  This is one of my favorite places to eat regularly and I hope others will like it as much as I do

Bring a good friend and show up early. A perfectly made bowl of noodles will be the light at the end of the tunnel. The broth (deep flavors of beef, soy, with a touch of sweetness) and beef (thinly sliced and well seared) somehow manage to steal the show from arguably the best locally made noodles in the Boston area.
Always Amazing. Food and service cannot be topped
Tiny specialty shop with only two or things on the menu but those menu options are absolutely incredible.
So tasty, sweet and salty broth with tender juicy beef and soft thick noodles. Yum!
awesome!
Amazing beef, nice thick noodles in the cold dish. Will go back
Simply delicious! The noodle has a perfect bite texture. The beef has a deep soy sauce flavor. Definitely order extra beef next time. And the broth is perfectly balanced.
Sarah is great and we scored a “Perfect” for the luscious cold bowl of incredible noodles.  Fun experience and line was only 10 minutes.
Get the cold udon!

Yume ga arukara provides the same experience as its sister shop, yume wo katare, only with udon.  The same great value is present, and it comes in a slightly more reasonable portion. As with its sister shop, come often; you'll have to wait, but at least you wait inside!
THIS is the place Neo was talking about.
Hands down the best Udon I've ever had. Definitely of BA's Top 10 award and here's hoping they continue to get recognized. Keep striving for that dream!
It was good but not worth the one hour line standing.

The softest and most flavorful udon of my life. After having lived in MA for 10+ years and in Boston for 3+, the first thing I do when I visit from NYC these days is go there for some udon. I usually take photos of food but it's so good I never get the chance.
